metadata.synopsis: You wake up the morning after the night where Astarion (companion) tried to bite you. Depending on your choices, he might have bitten you consensually or you might have told him to piss off. He'll be wary to see if you're still in a forgiving mood. The other companions chime in with their opinions on having a vampire around, and the player defends keeping Astarion in the party.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: Good morning. How do you feel?

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I'm fine, I just feel a little woozy.

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: It'll pass. Just be glad I'm not a 'true' vampire.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: My neck hurts, how do you think I feel?

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: Be grateful I'm not a 'true' vampire, then.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: A bite from them and you might wake up as a vampire spawn, like my good self. All of a vampire's hunger, but few of their powers.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I feel awful. We won't be doing that again.

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: A pity. Just be grateful I'm not a 'true' vampire.

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: Morning. I hope last night's little unpleasantness hasn't left a bad taste in your-

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: Well. I hope there are no bad feelings.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Not at all. Having a vampire on our side could be useful.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: Indeed it could. These are very helpful in a fight.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: He smiles, baring his fangs, and gestures to themNodeContext: 'These' referring to his fangs. He smiles widely and gestures to them.

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: Of course, I can't summon wolves or turn to mist like a 'true' vampire. Being a spawn has its drawbacks.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: No, but I have questions. How are you standing in the sun?

85.speaker: Astarion
85.text: Oh, I have no idea. By rights I should be cinders in this light. But someone - or something - is keeping me alive.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: No, but I have questions. How have you survived out there in the sun?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: You're lucky I didn't kill you.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: And you're lucky I'm not a 'true' vampire. Last night could have gone very differently if I'd magically summoned a pack of wolves.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: Alas, I'm just a spawn. All of the hunger, few of the powers.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Is that how you can stand in the sun? Because you're not a 'true' vampire?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Is that how you could stand in the sun? Because you're not a 'true' vampire?

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: Oh no, I should be cinders in this light. I hadn't seen the sun for two hundred years before we crashed here.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Any other drawbacks I should know about?

93.speaker: Astarion
93.text: Oh, I've no idea. For two hundred years, the sun would have turned me to cinders. Until the crash, when I woke up bathed in its light.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Pity. I thought you'd be more powerful.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: Perhaps I am. For two hundred years, the sun would have turned me to cinders. Now I stand here like it's nothing.

42.speaker: Astarion
42.text: Someone - or something - wants me alive. They've changed the rules.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: Standing in the sun, wading through a river, wandering into homes without an invitation - they're all perfectly mundane activities now.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: As for my other quirks - well, we can figure those out in time.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: What's causing this? The mind flayer's parasite?

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: That's my theory, but who knows?

87.speaker: Player
87.text: If I can help, just ask. We're in this together.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.context: NodeContext: verging on mocking, but not quite

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: I'm just glad you're being sensible about this. I was worried you might wake up and grab your torch and pitchfork.

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: But now that the air's clear, we should probably get moving. There's a long day ahead of us.

10.speaker: Astarion
10.text: I'm just glad you're being sensible about these revelations. I was worried people might turn up with torches and pitchforks.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks over his shoulder, realising someone's approachingNodeContext: Looks over his shoulder, realising someone's approaching

102.speaker: Gale
102.text: Well, we all have a monster inside us of one sort or another.

94.speaker: Karlach
94.text: Some of us more than others, but - yes.

95.speaker: Lae'zel
95.text: A vampire among us? So be it.

50.speaker: Lae'zel
50.text: But should I wake with so much as a drop of blood on my neck, I will end him.

59.speaker: Shadowheart
59.text: A vampire? Well that explains the pallor.

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.text: Given our group's nature, I don't see much harm. We're each monsters in the making, after all.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: Vamps don't scare me. As long as they keep their teeth to themselves.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: No sense judging someone for who they are. Except devils, obviously.

92.speaker: Wyll
92.text: Hunting with vampires? Never thought I'd see the day.

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: Very well - but I'm keeping an eye on you. And no wisecracks about having us for supper.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

86.speaker: Gale
86.text: So we're travelling with a vampire, are we? Of course we are.

96.speaker: Gale
96.text: A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful.

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: For his sake, he best not develop an appetite for githyanki.

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: I'd just better not wake in the night to find fangs at my throat.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: Yeah. And I'm way too hot to touch.

49.speaker: Wyll
49.text: Fine - as long as he keeps his fangs off our necks.

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: Oh, and a quick word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: A vamp, huh? Interesting. Keep your teeth to yourself, Astarion, and we won't have any issues.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: Anyway, you'd burn your tongue off if you went for this neck.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Enough. We need him, like it or not.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: They're not wrong. We're bound together, no matter what comes.
73.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the companion that's agressive towards you. The player defended you, and you're saying that the player isn't wrong.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I trust him. He won't hurt us.

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: Quite the opposite. I'm here in the spirit of openness and honesty, to work together as a team.
90.context: NodeContext: He doesn't mean it, but he's trying to sell it.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: If you don't like it, you can leave.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: I wouldn't recommend it. I won't get you, but the mind flayers might.
31.context: NodeContext: To the other companion, not the PC

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: Fine - he stays, 'til he's no longer of use. Besides, my flesh is not so easily tasted.

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: Unless, of course, I have offered it.

77.speaker: Shadowheart
77.text: Maybe we could get him to wear a bell - dissuade any night-time prowling.

101.speaker: Karlach
101.text: We all have our shit to bear. As long you remember your manners, Astarion, you're welcome at my fire.

9.speaker: Wyll
9.text: I just better not wake with any holes in my neck.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: There now. We're all friends again.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Shall we go? There's a long day ahead of us.

23.speaker: Gale
23.text: You say all the right words, but I'm not so sure you mean the right things. Still, I will respect the decision that was made.

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: So we're travelling with a vampire, are we?

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Figure them out quickly. I don't want any more surprises.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: No more surprises. You have my word.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion lays his hand on his heart.NodeContext: Astarion sounds sincere. He lays his hand on his heart.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: I wouldn't say that. Even the most powerful vampires in history couldn't survive in the sun, but it seems I can.
